chapters.name: Gaming
chapters.details:
After a long day of coding and facilitating in the developer community, I find solace in the virtual battlegrounds of Mobile Legends and The Finals. Gaming is my go-to stress buster, where I can unwind, laugh, and simply enjoy the moment without the pressures of leadership or teaching.

As a Jungler in Mobile Legends, I'm the core of the team, tasked with making strategic decisions that can turn the tide of battle. Though vastly different from my professional life, the thrill of gaming provides a necessary balance to my daily routine. It's a world where I can immerse myself in friendly competition and camaraderie with friends, many of whom are also part of my professional circle.

While we keep our work and play separate, gaming sessions with my developer friends are particularly memorable. We can let loose, share laughs, and bond over our shared passion for gaming.

When the week gets busy, I also find rejuvenation in the epic adventures of One Piece, my favorite anime series. These escapes allow me to recharge and return to my community work with renewed energy and focus.

body.text:

As a Jungler in Mobile Legends, I'm the core of the team, tasked with making strategic decisions that can turn the tide of battle. Though vastly different from my professional life, the thrill of gaming provides a necessary balance to my daily routine. While we keep our work and play separate, gaming sessions with my developer friends are particularly memorable. We can let loose, share laughs, and bond over our shared passion for gaming.

When the week gets busy, I also find rejuvenation in the epic adventures of One Piece, my favorite anime series. These escapes allow me to recharge and return to my community work with renewed energy and focus.

chapters.name: Go Outside
chapters.details:
In the tapestry of my life, the threads of personal joy are woven with vibrant hues, each strand a testament to the pleasures I find in the everyday.

As I navigate the realms of my passions, from the gym's rhythmic cadence to the dynamic world of JavaScript, I am reminded of the simple yet profound joy that underpins my existence.

The gym, my sanctuary of self-improvement, has become a cornerstone of my routine, a place where I dedicate four to five days a week to the pursuit of physical excellence. The weights and the treadmill are not just tools for fitness; they are instruments that play the melody of my dedication.

And with each sprint, especially those 5-7 minute bursts at the Bajra Sandi Renon yard, I feel a surge of pride. It's not about vanity or ego; it's about recognizing the strides I've made in my health, the tangible proof that I am, indeed, getting better.

This physical transformation has infused me with an energy that spills over into every facet of my life. It's not just the increased stamina, though that in itself is a triumph. It's the mental clarity that comes with knowing I am taking care of my body, honoring it with intermittent fasting and consistent workouts.

The discipline of my routine has become a source of happiness, a habit that I not only relish but am eager to expand upon. Consistency, I've learned, is the key to unlocking the door to continuous joy.

In the classroom, where I serve as a beacon for those eager to learn the language of the web, my personal joy is palpable. It's not that my teaching methods have shifted—professionalism and self-control remain my guiding principles.

But there's an undeniable lightness to my being, a humorous and fun vibe that I bring into each session. It's as if the joy I derive from my personal endeavors creates a ripple effect, touching the lives of my students and enhancing our collective experiences.

Every day presents a new chance to find happiness in the journey, to celebrate the small victories that remind me life is not just about the destination. Whether I'm at the gym pushing my limits or in the classroom sparking a love for code, the joy I find is a reflection of the energy I invest in myself. It's a reminder that in the pursuit of personal joy, the most important step is to simply revel in the act of living.

chapters.name: Google Developer Student Club
chapters.details:
Being a part of the Google Developer Student Club (GDSC) has been one of the most defining experiences of my life. I remember joining the core team with a mix of excitement and nervousness, not fully aware of the profound impact it would have on me. The GDSC was more than just a club; it was a gateway to a community that shared a collective spirit to grow and thrive in the tech industry.

Volunteering for Google I/O Extended Bali and Devfest Bali in 2022 was a highlight. The energy was infectious, and the opportunity to meet and collaborate with others who were just as passionate about technology as I was, was truly inspiring. It wasn't just about the events; it was about the people, the connections, and the shared vision of making a mark in the tech world.


This experience reinforced my belief in the power of community and collaboration. It was a testament to the idea that when you are committed to a goal, the universe does indeed conspire to help you achieve it. My time with the GDSC taught me that discipline and dedication are the cornerstones of success, whether in personal development, community engagement, or any other endeavor. It's a lesson I carry with me every day, in every goal I pursue.

chapters.name: Capstone Project
chapters.details:
In my sixth semester in college, I joined the Bangkit program, majoring in Cloud Computing. This independent study program allowed me to collaborate with others in the tech community, which was an incredible experience. Our team consisted of six people, with two from my campus and three from different campuses outside Bali. We worked together to build a Capstone project, Snapcook, an innovative app designed to reduce food waste from leftover food.

Using TensorFlow Lite for object detection, Snapcook could scan leftover food and provide recipe recommendations. As the lead and backend dev, I appreciated my teammates' hard work in finishing this project. We pitched Snapcook in a pitch session, receiving valuable feedback to improve the app further. Although it needed improvement, Snapcook remains one of the best projects I've worked on with others. The experience taught me the importance of collaboration and coordination in a diverse team.

body.text:

Our team consisted of six people, with two from my campus and three from different campuses outside Bali. Using TensorFlow Lite for object detection, Snapcook could scan leftover food and provide recipe recommendations. As the lead and backend dev, I appreciated my teammates' hard work in finishing this project. We pitched Snapcook in a pitch session, receiving valuable feedback to improve the app further. Although it needed improvement, Snapcook remains one of the best projects I've worked on with others. The experience taught me the importance of collaboration and coordination in a diverse team.

chapters.name: Google I/O Extended Bali
chapters.details:
Being part of the Core Team for Google Developers Student Clubs has been one of the most exhilarating experiences of my life. It's not just about the title or the role; it's about the doors it opens and the people you meet along the way. In 2023, I had the privilege to help organize Google I/O Extended Bali and Devfest Bali. These events are not just conferences; they are a confluence of ideas, innovation, and inspiration.

Google I/O Extended Bali was particularly special. It's an event that extends the excitement of Google I/O, bringing together developers and tech enthusiasts from across the island and beyond. As a facilitator and someone deeply involved in the developer community, being able to contribute to such an event was both an honor and a challenge. The preparation was intense, but the outcome was immensely rewarding. We collaborated closely with Google Developers Group Bali and Women Techmakers Bali, which enriched the experience with diverse perspectives and expertise.

The sense of community at these events is palpable. You're surrounded by individuals who are not just colleagues or acquaintances but are passionate about technology and eager to share their knowledge. It's an environment where learning is celebrated, and every conversation could lead to a new idea or a better understanding of a complex concept. 

I remember the buzz of activity, the anticipation before the keynote speeches, and the shared excitement as we unveiled new technologies. But what stood out to me the most was the collective effort. Everyone played a part, from the organizers to the volunteers, and each role was crucial to the event's success. 
In the following year, Devfest Bali grew even larger, with more participants and an impressive lineup of speakers. Although I stepped back from volunteering to be a regular participant, the joy of being part of the community didn't diminish. It was a different perspective, but the camaraderie and the thrill of learning remained the same.

Organizing Google I/O Extended Bali was not just a milestone in my professional journey but also a testament to the power of community. It's a reminder that when we come together with a shared passion, we can create experiences that resonate long after the last session ends.

chapters.name: Friends
chapters.details:
My friends have been a constant source of support and motivation in my life. They're not just friends, but also my gaming buddies and colleagues in the dev community. We share a common interest in gaming, and it's amazing how we can switch between being serious about our work and having fun playing games like Mobile Legends and The Finals.

My friends have been incredibly supportive of my fitness journey. They've noticed the changes in me and have been encouraging me to continue. In fact, one of my seniors even joined the gym after I started going, and now I'm teaching him too! It's great to have a circle of friends who share a positive vibe and motivate each other to make changes.

Playing games with my friends is a great way for me to unwind and relieve stress. It's a separate aspect of my life that I keep distinct from my professional circle, but it's amazing how many of my friends overlap between the two. We make sure to keep our work and playtime separate, but it's great to have friends who understand and support me in both aspects of my life.

chapters.name: New professional
chapters.details:
As I reflect on my journey into the world of programming and my evolution as a professional, I'm struck by how far I've come from those early days of playing "Game House" on a PC in elementary school. That innocent fascination with technology blossomed into a passion that led me to major in software engineering in high school. But it wasn't until I joined the Primakara Developers community that I truly began to understand the depth of my interest and the potential of my career path.

Starting as a participant in the community, I absorbed knowledge voraciously. Within a year, I found myself stepping up as a facilitator for an Intermediate Front-End Class. This transition was both exhilarating and challenging. Grappling with complex JavaScript concepts like promises, asynchronous operations, and API fetching was tough, but it was a hill I was determined to climb. These challenges became the crucibles that honed my skills, allowing me to not only master JavaScript but also to share that knowledge with others.

As I grew into my role as a facilitator, I came to realize the profound importance of professionalism in this field. Teaching JavaScript and engaging with the developer community through events like Google IO Extended Bali and Devfest Bali in 2023 has been a rewarding experience, but it's also taught me valuable lessons about maintaining self-control and composure in various situations.

I've learned to strike a delicate balance between bringing my own personality into the classroom and adhering to professional standards. At Primakara Developers class, I've found a way to express myself and enjoy the teaching process while still meeting the expectations placed upon me. It's a dance of sorts, where I can be humorous and fun, yet always ensuring that I maintain a professional demeanor.

This professionalism extends beyond the classroom. Working with solid teams in organizations like GDG Bali and Women Tech Maker Bali has shown me the impact of high standards in making annual events not just amazing, but truly impactful. Being part of these communities has expanded my network, leading to numerous professional opportunities. Much of my work now comes from these relationships, highlighting the importance of networking in our field.

As I continue to grow as a professional, I've come to see that networking is more than just a means to an end. It's a way to stay current with tech trends and developments, engaging in discussions that keep my knowledge fresh and relevant. This continuous learning environment, fostered by the connections I've made, has become an integral part of my professional identity.

chapters.name: Exercise Journey
chapters.details:
Here is the writeup on my "Exercise Journey" from my perspective:

Embarking on a fitness journey is like setting sail on uncharted waters - exhilarating yet daunting. Two months ago, I heeded a friend's advice and took a leap of faith that has since transformed my life. 

I meticulously crafted a gym routine that now punctuates my weekdays with a rhythm that's become the cornerstone of my existence. Mondays are for push exercises, Tuesdays for pull, and Wednesdays challenge me with leg day. Thursdays are my rest days, a crucial aspect of my regimen, and Fridays are for honing my shoulders. This structured routine is more than just about the workouts; it's about instilling the discipline of rest, allowing my body to recover and grow stronger.

In tandem with my gym routine, I've embraced intermittent fasting, setting a disciplined eating schedule. My mornings begin with breakfast between 9 to 10 AM, followed by lunch around 1 or 2 PM, and I conclude with a meal that includes a mix of fruits before 5 PM. The evenings are now free from eating, a stark contrast to my old habits. It was a struggle at first, but it's now a part of my life that brings me joy. I've become more disciplined and respectful of what I eat, and I don't bother with tracking every calorie.

The physical progress I've made doesn't directly influence my teaching style or content as a JavaScript facilitator, but I believe that all aspects of my health journey positively impact my daily activities. I approach my classes with a humorous and fun vibe, and my improved stamina allows me to deliver hands-on demos with more dynamism. Although I'm not sure if my students have noticed this change, I always strive to meet a standard in my teaching, ensuring professionalism and self-control in the learning environment.

The stamina I've gained from this health-focused lifestyle has had a significant impact on my jogging routine. Before, I could barely manage more than a few minutes at a time, but now I find myself sprinting for 5-7 minutes during my Sunday runs at Bajra Sandi Renon yard. It's a remarkable improvement, and while I don't believe I had any mental issues before, I feel a sense of pride in my health achievements. Consistency is all I need.

For the first time I hit the gym, my weight was around 97kg. After two months of dedication to the gym and fasting, I've lost about 10kg, and my weight is now 87kg. This achievement has not only been a physical transformation but also a mental one. The discipline and consistency I've cultivated in my personal health journey have spilled over into every facet of my life, including my professional endeavors. My target is hitting 85kg by the end of April 2024.All of my gym exercises are a favorite day, but I don't quite enjoy my shoulder day as much. Shoulders are an important part of supporting other exercises like bench press, and I initially lacked knowledge about different shoulder movements. However, I ended up talking and working out with friends who guided me on proper form and breathing techniques. Their advice has made a significant difference, and I now truly enjoy all aspects of my exercise schedule.
My friends have been incredibly supportive of my decision to make changes, and without their encouragement, I might not have embarked on this gym journey. Their positivity has even inspired some of them to join me, and I now find myself teaching a senior friend the ropes as a beginner. It's really good having a circle that has a positive vibe to make changes together.

In essence, the combination of exercise and fasting has been a game-changer for me. It's not just about the physical benefits but also about the mental clarity and discipline that have permeated every aspect of my life. It's a continuous process of growth and development, and I'm committed to seeing just how far this path will lead.

chapters.name: Snapcook Test
chapters.details:
I still remember the Bangkit program, where I worked on a Cloud Computing learning path project called Snapcook. It was a Capstone project that required collaboration with my team of six people from different campuses.

We used Discord for online meetings to coordinate our efforts. Snapcook is an innovative app that helps reduce food waste by recommending recipes based on leftover ingredients.

We achieved this by using TensorFlow Lite for object detection from pictures captured. The app was well-received during the pitch session, and although we knew it needed improvement, I was proud of what we accomplished. 

As the lead and backend dev, I appreciated my teammates' hard work in finishing the project. Snapcook remains one of the best projects I've worked on, and I'm grateful for the experience.

chapters.name: Gym Exercise
chapters.details: I've been going to the gym for four months now, and it's been a game-changer. I've lost 10kg in two months, and visually, my body has changed a lot. My favorite gym exercise is actually all of them - I keep a tight schedule and make sure to do each one consistently. I've learned that consistency is key, and it took me a month to make going to the gym a habit. Now, I feel fresh every day, and my outfits fit well. My friends have been really supportive of my transformation, and it's great to have them noticing the changes in me. I've realized that gym exercise isn't just about physical change, but also about building confidence and self-control. It's amazing how much of an impact it's had on my life.
